ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
Class SUSHI

java.lang.Object
  ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.AbstractResourceSelection
      ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.SUSHI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceSelection
public final class SUSHI
extends AbstractResourceSelection

For each resource SUSHI learns the transformation function from a document complete rank to a document centralized score: score_c = f(rank_complete). The complete rank is estimated as rank_complete = resource_size / size_of_sample * (rank_sample - 0.5), where rank_sample is the rank of a document in CSI.

Author:
Ilya Markov
See Also:
"SUSHI: scoring scaled samples for server selection", Paul Thomas and Milad Shokouhi. In Proceedings of SIGIR, pages 419--426, 2009.

Nested Class Summary
private static class SUSHI.Regression
          An abstract class that performs regression of the type y = a * f(x) + b, where the function f should be overridden by subclasses.

getResourceScores

protected <T> Map<Resource,Double> getResourceScores(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                                     List<Resource> resources)
Description copied from class: AbstractResourceSelection
Calculates scores for resources in resources based on the ranking of scored documents in documents. Returns a mapping between resources and their scores.

At this point scored documents must be sorted descending with respect to their scores.

This method must be overridden by subclasses.

Specified by:
getResourceScores in class AbstractResourceSelection
Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
Returns:
The mapping between resources and their scores.
See Also:
AbstractResourceSelection.getResourceScores(List, java.util.List)

getResource2Regression

private <T> Map<Resource,SUSHI.Regression> getResource2Regression(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                                                  List<Resource> resources)
For each distinct resource in resources returns the best-fit regression between scores and ranks of documents in that resource.

private SUSHI.Regression[] getRegressions()
